definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: They would say that she is not worthy of possessing her shiny black hair and dark 4)almond eyes.
sentences.chinese: 会说她不配拥有亮泽的黑发和深色的杏眼。

sentences.english: The young girl has a pair of almond eyes.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻的姑娘长著一双杏眼。

sentences.english: July a pair of almonds eye son suddenly Shan suddenly Shan, 1 face expectancy the ground looking by one oneself space space.
sentences.chinese: 七月一双杏眼儿忽闪忽闪，一脸期待地看着自家格格。

definition: elegant, almond-shaped eyes with the inner canthus pointing down and the outer canthus up, like the eye of a phoenix
red phoenix eyes (eyes whose outer corners incline upwards)
lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
see 櫻桃小嘴|樱桃小嘴[ying1 tao2 xiao3 zui3]
eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
autumn ripples/(fig.) luminous eyes of a woman/amorous glance
